p: Inflammation was induced in mice by topical administration of two drops of xylene at the inner surface of the right ear. The xylene was left to act for 15 min. L. sericeus stem extract (310, 620 and 930 mg/kg, i.p.), dexamethasone (4 mg/kg, orally) and distilled water (0.2 ml/kg, orally) were administered to various groups of mice 30 min before the induction of inflammation. The animals were sacrificed under light anesthesia and the left ears were cut. The difference between the ear weights was taken as the edema induced by the xylene (Mbagwu et al., 2007 ▶; Okokon and Nwafor, 2010 ▶; Tjolsen et al., 1992 ▶).
